snippet: They showed that neutrinos, which are found in three “flavors,” could oscillate from one flavor to another, demonstrating that they have mass.

byline.contributor: Jonathan Soble contributed reporting from Tokyo.

abstract: Nobel Prize in Physics is awarded to Takaaki Kajita of University of Tokyo and Arthur B McDonald of Queen's University in Ontario for their work in determining that subatomic particles known as neutrinos, the most abundant particles in the universe, have mass; discovery has helped cosmologists understand evolution of universe, workings of the sun, and how supernova explosions occur.
lead_paragraph: They showed that neutrinos, which are found in three “flavors,” could oscillate from one flavor to another, demonstrating that they have mass.

headline.print_headline: Physics Nobel Is Awarded for Work on Neutrinos
headline.main: Takaaki Kajita and Arthur McDonald Share Nobel in Physics for Work on Neutrinos
